factText: Holy Fire Flares Up Near Santiago Peak, 150 Acres Burned, 10 Percent Contained  Firefighters battled Tuesday a new flare-up from the nearly 23,000-acre Holy Fire that has been burning for three weeks . Devastating HOLY FIRE in Trabuco Canyon area injures 2 firefighters and burns more than 4000 acres. #HolyFire update: 4000 acres burned with 0% containment. It is moving quickly in all directions. Crews will continue to work through the night.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-003_Wildfire_How many acres have burned due to {event}?

factText: The Ortega (74) Highway between San Juan Capistrano and Lake Elsinore was closed from Aug. 8 to Aug. 14 due to the monster blaze. The Holy Fire bore down on Lake Elsinore and surrounding communities for six days, prompting mandatory evacuations and road closures. Riverside Drive is still CLOSED between the hillclimb and East Redington Rd due to debris on the roadway from flooding. PennDot should have the roadway open tomorrow..
Prior to Monday’s apparent flare-up, the fire had burned an estimated 22,986 acres in Orange and Riverside counties, and it damaged or destroyed 24 structures, officials said.

#BREAKING @OCFA_PIO reporting more than 1000 acres have burned in the #HolyFire. Mandatory evacuations issued for H… https://t.co/JNKtOjVBki. A wildfire dubbed the 'Holy Fire' has spread at an unprecedented rate across Cleveland National Forest in California, according to the Orange County Fire Authorities on Tuesday.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-003_general_What news outlets are reporting on {event} and what are they saying?

factText: Stranded hikers rescued as fast-moving #holyfire sweeps through Southern California forest: https://t.co/bk2RTNsFpk https://t.co/CQCn86EIUK

The wildfire burning in Orange County, dubbed the Holy Fire, has already scorched more than 1,000 acres. Mandatory evacuations are being issued. https://bit.ly/2OiW9vI. Aggressive wildfire in Orange County - 700 acres and growing rapidly. Evacuations underway. https://t.co/ufObpALF0G. This is horrible, another fire in #SoCal.  Hoping everyone stays safe. #HolyFire
If you see a plume of smoke, it may be coming from the Holy Fire, which started around 2 p.m. in the Holy Jim and Trabuco Canyons in Orange County and is spreading towards Riverside County.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-003_Wildfire_Is the wildfire spreading towards residential areas in {event}?

factText: OCFA will continue to have strike team engines in the area of Robinson Ranch to monitor the fire.

Call 2-1-1,1-888-600-4357 or text your zip code to 898211 for information about the Holy Fire: evacuations, road closures, etc. Impacted residents in the Holy Jim area may call the Public Information Hotline at (714)628-7085. #HolyFire. For Holy Fire information please call 951-736-1811.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-003_general_What emergency numbers should people call for help during {event}?

factText: Crews are battling a rapidly-spreading brush fire in the Trabuco Canyon area of Orange County, prompting evacuations for some residents. Emergency refill procedures are in place through August 17,2018, for Riverside, Shasta, Lake, Mendocino, and Napa Counties, California due to wildfires. A fast-moving fire is burning in Orange and Riverside counties. It is currently more than 1,000 acres and threatening structures.

factText: UPDATE: Riverside Drive is still closed due to debris from flooding. PennDOT should have the roadway open today.
Did you know that Costa Mesa Fire & Rescue teams assist throughout California when wildfires spread. Stay safe everyone. Thank you for your service. 🇺🇸🚒

factText: The wildfire remains zero percent contained after burning 4,000 acres. Kara Finnstrom reports.… https://t.co/BBKa1BT6Sv

SMOKE ADVISORY UPDATE: #HolyFire continues to affect our air quality; meteorological conditions may bring smoke into portions of #OrangeCounty, #RiversideCounty, and #SanBernardinoCounty: bit.ly/AQMDa. @ABC7 UPDATE: Voluntary #HolyFire evacuation warning issued for Highway 74 corridor in Lake Elsinore 2:35 PM - 7 Aug 2018

Fire activity will increase as temps increase today. Mid level winds are changing to a NW flow pushing some smoke back into Northeast #OrangeCounty #cawx #HolyFire https://t.co/17Oe0771q7. #HolyFire the west/ridge top winds will be increasing over the next few hours. If the fire burns to the ridge tops… https://t.co/aKp3qyk27X. Winds out of the south west today will continue to push the #HolyFire in a north east direction, officials say. https://t.co/ICQvabhkTF

factText: Live look at the Holy Fire which is now at 4,000 acres and 2% containment. CALIFORNIA FIRES: SkyFOX is over the Holy Fire in Orange County, California, which is now at 4,000 acres and only 2-percent contained. Holy Fire Update: 4000 acres and 0% containment. #HolyFire #OCFA https://t.co/q86pKqIwvp  — Cleveland NF (ClevelandNF) August 7, 2018
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-003_Wildfire_What percentage of the wildfire is contained in {event}?

factText: LIVE VIDEO: Firefighters continue to battle the fires in California. Hundreds of firefighters are battling the Trabuco Canyon wildfire as temperatures soar. More than 14,000 firefighters are now battling over a dozen major blazes across the state. Thousands of firefighters are currently battling the flames of 18 active wildfires, which are threatening communities from Redding in Northern California to Riverside County in Southern California.

There are currently 10 helicopters & 5 air tankers supporting firefighters on the ground at the #HolyFire incident.… https://t.co/BghHOZqehX. Orange County Fire Authority Capt. Tony Bommarito said five air tankers and four helicopters were assigned to the fire, with the primary goal of protecting communication towers on the peak.

"Residents should exit west to Orange County to avoid fire equipment coming up on the Elsinore side," the USFS said. Trabuco Canyon brush fire: Fast-moving blaze burns 4,000 acres, prompts evacuations. The Holy Jim Fire, Trabuco canyon and holy Jim canyons are burning. Mandatory Evacuations for both. Burning at a rate of 700 acres per hour.

#HolyFire — Important update from the US Forest Service this afternoon: NOTICE - VOLUNTARY EVACUATION WARNING FOR HIGHWAY 74 CORRIDOR Highway 74 (Ortega Highway) west from Lookout Restaurant to Nichol. Please keep a watch on the #HOLYfire - started in Holy Jim Canyon. Trabuco Canyon, several evacs are underway in the campgrounds. Ortega Hwy, Temescal Canyon Evac Warnings Issued For Holy Fire
